task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 304°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will look up to see the top.
I have seen the top of the building, now I need to look down to see the base to get a full sense of its height.

Having viewed both the top and the base of the building, I can now estimate its height by counting the floors; it appears to have a ground floor and six upper floors, which I will use to calculate the total height.
